workflow.name: Monitor and report FAQ freshness from Notion to Google Sheets and Slack
workflow.description:
## Description
Keep your internal knowledge base fresh and reliable with this automated FAQ freshness monitoring system. üß†üìÖ
 This workflow tracks FAQ update dates in Notion, calculates SLA compliance, logs results in Google Sheets, and sends Slack alerts for outdated items. Perfect for documentation teams ensuring content accuracy and operational visibility across platforms. üöÄüí¨

## What This Template Does
1Ô∏è‚É£ Triggers every Monday at 10:00 AM to start freshness checks. ‚è∞
 2Ô∏è‚É£ Fetches FAQ entries from your Notion database. üìö
 3Ô∏è‚É£ Computes SLA status based on the last edited date (30-day threshold). üìÜ
 4Ô∏è‚É£ Updates a Google Sheet with current FAQ details and freshness status. üìä
 5Ô∏è‚É£ Filters out overdue FAQs that need review. üîç
 6Ô∏è‚É£ Aggregates all overdue items into one report. üßæ
 7Ô∏è‚É£ Sends a consolidated Slack alert with direct Notion links and priority tags. üí¨

## Key Benefits
‚úÖ Maintains documentation freshness across systems.
 ‚úÖ Reduces support friction from outdated FAQs.
 ‚úÖ Centralizes visibility with Google Sheets reporting.
 ‚úÖ Notifies your team in real time via Slack.
 ‚úÖ Enables SLA-based documentation governance.

## Features
- Weekly automated schedule (every Monday at 10 AM).
- Notion database integration for FAQ retrieval.
- SLA computation and overdue filtering logic.
- Google Sheets sync for audit logging.
- Slack notification for overdue FAQ alerts.
- Fully configurable thresholds and alerting logic.

## Requirements
- Notion API credentials with database read access.
- Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials with edit access.
- Slack Bot Token with chat:write  permission.
- Environment variables :
- NOTION_FAQ_DATABASE_ID
- GOOGLE_SHEET_FAQ_ID
- SLACK_FAQ_ALERT_CHANNEL_ID

## Target Audience
Knowledge management and documentation teams üßæ
SaaS product teams maintaining FAQ accuracy üí°
Support operations and customer success teams üí¨
QA and compliance teams monitoring SLA adherence üìÖ

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
1Ô∏è‚É£ Connect Notion credentials and set your FAQ database ID.
 2Ô∏è‚É£ Create a Google Sheet with required headers (Title, lastEdited, slaStatus, etc.).
 3Ô∏è‚É£ Add your Slack credentials and specify the alert channel ID.
 4Ô∏è‚É£ Configure the cron schedule (0 10 * * 1) for Monday 10:00 AM checks.
 5Ô∏è‚É£ Run once manually to verify credentials and mappings.
 6Ô∏è‚É£ Activate for ongoing weekly freshness monitoring. ‚úÖ

workflow.name: Monitor and Report FAQ Freshness from Notion to Google Sheets and Slack

parameters.content:
## üìã FAQ Freshness Monitor

### How it works
This workflow keeps your FAQ documentation fresh by checking when each FAQ in your Notion database was last updated. It runs every Monday morning, calculates which entries are older than 30 days, and updates a Google Sheet with the results. If any FAQs are overdue, a Slack alert goes out to your chosen channel. This helps the team stay on top of content maintenance without manual checks.

### Setup steps
1. Connect your Notion, Google Sheets, and Slack accounts in n8n.
2. In Notion, share your FAQ database with the n8n integration and note the database ID.
3. Create a Google Sheet with the headers listed in this workflow.
4. Add your sheet ID and Slack channel ID as environment variables.
5. Adjust the schedule time if needed (default is Monday, 10 AM).
6. Run once manually to confirm everything‚Äôs flowing correctly.
7. Enable the workflow and let it handle the weekly checks automatically.

## Data Source & Trigger 

This section controls when and where data comes from.
- The Schedule Trigger starts the workflow automatically every Monday at 10 AM.
- The Notion node connects to your FAQ database and pulls all records for analysis.
Tip: Make sure your Notion integration has access and the database ID is set correctly.

## Overdue Detection & Message Prep


This section filters out FAQs that haven‚Äôt been updated in the last 30 days.
- The IF node checks the SLA status (OVERDUE).
- The Set and Aggregate nodes format all overdue items into a single message array for Slack.
You can adjust the filter logic or add extra criteria (like severity).

## Data Processing & Storage


Here, the workflow transforms the Notion data and syncs it with Google Sheets.
- The Set node maps FAQ fields (title, last edited, severity, etc.).
- The Sheets node appends or updates rows in your sheet, using ‚ÄúTitle‚Äù as the match key.
You can tweak this mapping if your Notion field names differ.

## Alerts & Communication


Finally, the workflow sends the summary message to Slack.
- If there are overdue FAQs, a detailed message is sent to the configured channel.
- Optionally, you can add a small ‚ÄúAll Clear‚Äù message node for cases with no overdue items.
Tip: Test this manually once to confirm Slack permissions and formatting.

assignments.name: overdueList

parameters.text:
=:warning: *FAQ Freshness Alert - Overdue Items Detected*  

The following FAQs have exceeded the 30-day freshness SLA and need review and is Overdue:

{{ $json.data[0].overdueList }}

_Please update these FAQs to ensure documentation accuracy.

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
